Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: jumbo \jum"bo\ (j[u^]m"b[-o]), a. [From the name Jumbo, given to a very large elephant exhibited as part of P. T. Barnum's circus in 1882.] Very large. [PJC]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: jumbo \jum"bo\ (j[u^]m"b[-o]), n. Any object which is a very large example of its class. [PJC]

Dictionary.Name: Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)

Definition.WordDefinition: JUMBO Java Universal Molecular Browser for Objects (XML)
jumbo adj : of great mass; huge and bulky; "a jumbo jet"; "jumbo shrimp" [syn: {elephantine}, {gargantuan}, {giant}]
